page.title: 17Religion in Wilton Area
page.content: The original Parish Church of Wilton dating from the Middle Ages & now derelict, can still be seen in the Market Square. Present day Anglicans enjoy a fine, large, Italianate church built 150 years ago in West St.Regular services are held there and in the Priory Church of St.John Baptist, Wilton; St.Catherine, Netherhampton, & St.Peter, Fugglestone. Members of the free church in the area must travel to Wilton for regular services. There is a Baptist Church (once the Town Hall) in the Market Square and close by is St.Edith's. This church, named after the patron saint of Wilton, was once the Council Chamber & is now shared by the Methodist and United Reformed Church and the Roman Catholics of the area. There is a spiritualst group in the town.About 8% of local pop.regularly attend church.
